description.hltext_display: 1車拒攔檢逃逸 警追查
description.content:
〔中央社〕蘆洲警方今天上午攔查1輛未懸掛車牌的車輛，車輛駕駛不僅拒停車受檢，還開車衝撞警車，警方見狀雖鳴槍示警並朝輪胎開3槍，但車輛仍逃逸無蹤。
台北縣政府警察局蘆洲分局指出，蘆洲分局員警上午約9時騎機車巡邏經過集賢路、五華街口，發現1輛黑色自小客車沒有懸掛車牌，行跡可疑，於是上前攔查。
這輛不明車輛駕駛不僅拒絕停車接受盤查，還倒車衝撞警方，情勢危急，員警見狀雖鳴槍示警並朝輪胎開3槍，但對方仍強行繞過警車逆向行駛，其間還擦撞2部機車，往三重方向逃逸。
警方指出，案發後雖動員線上警網圍捕，但這輛車子早就逃逸無蹤，最後在二重疏洪道微風運河附近找到這輛車，但車內駕駛已不知去向，警方目前正調閱路口監視畫面，深入追查。

description.hltext_display: 刘煜辉：预计明年宏观经济目标是“做实泡沫”
description.content: 中国经济网北京12月22日讯 昨日，刘煜辉发表题为《刺破泡沫和经济减速恐怕是中国必须付出代价》的博文。文章希望，国家将稳健货币政策和积极财政政策搭配使用，通过发展和改革来解决各种棘手问题，如结构失衡、泡沫和通胀。一方面着手开始修正过往极宽的货币条件，回归稳健，但另一方面还是要防止出现泡沫的刚性破裂；选择的是“做实泡沫”的思路，希望实现通胀和泡沫的软着陆。 文章指出，2011年中国经济政策定位于“积极稳健审慎灵活”，这是关于处理“保增长、调结构、控通胀”三个宏观目标的关系的政策原则，基本可以解读为宏观决策层不太会采取全局性紧缩的调控来应对当前日益严重的资产泡沫和通货膨胀。 文章还指出，由于中国通胀的逻辑是货币-资产-物价，所以当下的物价上涨一定是一个货币量累积的过程，过去8年中，中国的货币量涨了4倍，高速工业化驱动着名义经济总量只涨了2倍，高估的土地和房地产像海绵一样吸食着溢出的货币量。 文章分析称，中国经济的速度从来靠的是投资和重化工，而那一块与就业关联不大。速度下来了，流动性潮水退去，中国的商品价格将大幅下跌，反而增加当下制造业部门竞争力。它们是活得更好，而不是更坏，有更多的机会雇佣更多的人，而不是被成本逼着用机器替代人工或转移工厂。中国经济的制造部分抗击打的弹性在全球主要经济体中是强大的，受损的其实是资产部门。而这些部门本就该为中国经济转型支付成本。 文章认为，积极财政政策成为重要的给力点。通过在民生方向扩张供给，如大力推进公屋建设计划，大力推进医疗、教育、养老等民生建设，来消除家庭的不安全感，提升他们的实际支付能力和收入，实质性扩大消费的能力；通过减税和减费(特别是减少企业上交的社保费用)，推动私人部门和民营经济发展，扩大就业；通过对中低收入者发放生活补贴，来增强其忍耐通胀的能力。但是，多目标之间的冲突往往会损害理想宏观目标的实现。 博文地址：http://liuyvhui.blog.sohu.com/164719190.html 作者简介： 刘煜辉：经济学博士，中国社会科学院金融重点实验室主任，中国经济评价中心主任，香港金融管理局(HKMA)客座研究员，国内多所大学特聘教授。 [编辑: 王好] 分享: 【 大 中 小 】【 rss订阅 】【 打印 】【 关闭 】 近日热点 市场预期年内或再加息 各大银行提前还贷潮涌现 2010 12/20 06:56 "年终工作总结"愁煞上班族 恶搞版网上疯传 2010 12/21 14:46 媒体称明起汽柴油每吨分别上调310元300元 2010 12/21 17:31 白领该去哪打拼 中国未来5大"聚宝地"(图) 2010 12/21 14:26 银行收费项目太多? 教你做"逃费达人" 2010 12/21 14:09 月供3000元 中年教师家庭如何过上无忧生活 2010 12/20 15:17 济南推出奢华圣诞大餐10万一桌 吃的不是饭 2010 12/20 15:41 80后硕士生回收废品 毕业前买车买房揽女友 2010 12/21 14:19 李宁进军体育地产受挫 市值一天内缩水30亿 2010 12/21 14:26 最牛购房者出书 与开发商死扛三年获赔(图) 2010 12/20 15:43

description.hltext_display: 广州2015年GDP预计将达1.8万亿元
description.content:
广州市委常委、常务副市长邬毅敏在12月22日召开的政协十一届广州市常委会二十三次会议上表示，十二五期间广州市预期达到的目标是，到2015年将达到1.8万亿。
广
州市委常委、常务副市长邬毅敏在12月22日召开的政协十一届广州市常委会二十三次会议上表示，十二五期间广州市预期达到的目标是，全市生产总值年均增长11%以上，到2015年将达到1.8万亿。
在目前外贸仍显疲软的情况下，为了达至上述增长目标，未来广州将努力在扩大内需上做大文章。其中，在投资方面，十二五期间广州将安排258个大项目，总投资1.5万亿元，十二五期间完成投资8000亿元，有望带动全社会固投3万亿元，平均每年在5000亿元以上。
邬毅敏还透露，广州2010年经济增长率将达12.5%左右，GDP总量将突破万亿元大关，成为国内第三个GDP突破万亿的城市。
在GDP突破万亿的同时，今年广州的地方财政预算超过800亿元，全社会固定资产投资和社会消费品零售总额将分别达到3000亿元和4000亿元以上，第三产业占GDP比重将达61%，人均GDP达10万元。

description.hltext_display: 예금 금리(2~4%� )은 물� 국내 � �축은행의 1년 � �기예금 평� 금리(5.10%)보다도 높다. 한네트 주가는 올 1월4일 2450원에서 이달 22일 3000원으로 22.4% 올랐다. 올 초부터 한네트 주식을 보�
description.content:
[한네트 등 6개사, 5%이상 시가배당률 제공… 시세차익+배당수익 `일석이조`]
연말을 맞이해 `통큰 배당`을 제시하는 종목들이 속속 등장하고 있다.
시세차익과 함께 배당수익까지 노릴수 있는 투자자들은 신이 났다.
22일 금융감독원·한국거래소에 따르면 이달 들어 현금배당 공시를 내놓은 종목은 코스피 10종목, 코스닥 51종목 등 총 61개 종목에 이른다. 이들 종목의 평균 시가배당률은 2.42%이지만 종목별 편차는 컸다.
가장 높은 시가배당률을 제시한 종목은 코스닥시장에 상장된 한네트였다.
금융단말시스템 등을 제조하는 한네트는 지난 14일 공시를 통해 보통주 1주당 250원씩 현금배당을 실시하기로 했다고 밝혔다. 시가배당률은 8.62%에 이른다. 시중은행 1년 정기예금 금리(2~4%선)은 물론 국내 저축은행의 1년 정기예금 평균금리(5.10%)보다도 높다.
한네트 주가는 올 1월4일 2450원에서 이달 22일 3000원으로 22.4% 올랐다. 올 초부터 한네트 주식을 보유하고 있었던 주주는 주가상승으로 인한 시세차익에 더해 별도의 배당수익까지 거머쥘 수 있게 된 셈이다. 한네트는 총 28억9000만원을 현금배당으로 지급할 예정이다. 지난해 당기순이익(70억원)의 41.3%에 달하는 규모다.
코스피 상장사 중에서는 한미반도체가 가장 높은 시가배당률을 제시하고 있다. 한미반도체는 지난 8일 보통주 1주당 500원씩 총 127억원을 현금배당하기로 했다고 밝혔다. 시가배당률은 6.28%에 달한다.
이밖에 크린앤사이언스(6.42%) 브리지텍(6.2%) 후너스(5.28%) 리노공업(5.1%) 등 6개사가 5%대 이상의 시가배당률을 제시했다.
인화정공(4.4%) 한국트로닉스(4.4%) 인포바인(4.31%) 진양제약(4.3%) 상신브레이크(4.1%) 등이 4%대, 에스피지(3.67%) 이상네트웍스(3.39%) 등은 3%대의 시가배당률을 각각 제시했다.
전문가들은 이미 3분기 말부터 배당주에 대한 관심증가로 주가가 많이 올랐지만 배당주 투자가 늦지 않았다고 말하고 있다.
백효원 솔로몬투자증권 연구원은 "배당주는 저금리와 시장의 낮은 주가수익비율(PER)이 맞물릴 때 매력적"이라며 "최근 상승장 때문에 시장 전체의 PER이 다소 높아졌지만 과도하게 높다고 볼 수는 없는 수준"이라고 말했다.
또 "연말이라 하더라도 배당주는 안정적 수익과 자본수익까지 얻을 수 있기 때문에 투자하기 늦지 않았다"며 "중형 대형 종목 중에서 현금을 많이 보유한 곳, 필수소비재 섹터 등 전통적으로 배당을 많이 실시한 업종 등을 주목할 필요가 있다"고 덧붙였다.
[황국상기자 gshwang@]

description.hltext_display: 华夏银行龙舟计划再起航 为小企业成长加油
description.content: 中国经济网北京12月22日讯 “中小企业承担着就业和增添经济发展活力的重任，但是资金仍然是个大问题。”昨天在华夏银行龙舟计划小企业成长加油站全国巡回活动的启动仪式上，众多嘉宾发出了共同的声音。 最新的中央经济工作会议精神要求，要把好流动性总闸门，把信贷资金更多投向实体经济特别是“三农”和中小企业，更好服务于保持经济平稳较快发展。 “小企业成长加油站”全国巡回活动是华夏银行龙舟计划继“华夏之星优秀小企业先锋大汇”后又一扶持小企业的活动，通过深化“龙舟计划”创新产品与服务的品牌内涵，在北京、青岛、成都、武汉、南京、温州等多个城市展开全国巡回活动，众多小企业客户将获得免费金融知识培训，引导小企业根据自身情况选择最合适、最有效的金融服务产品，让众多小企业普遍受益，获得发展新动力。 作为一家中型股份制上市商业银行，华夏银行始终将服务中小企业视为华夏银行应当承担的社会责任。多年来，华夏银行在为小企业提供优质金融服务的道路上不断进行探索，不断创新研发适合小企业金融服务需求的产品，服务了一大批小企业客户。 2009年华夏银行推出小企业金融服务品牌“龙舟计划”，和具有“小、快、灵”特点的产品，根据小企业成长周期，规划了“创业通舟、展业神舟、卓业龙舟”三大产品系列，整合创新了融资、结算、理财等35个产品和服务方案。从客户需求、担保方式、贷款期限、利率定价、还款方式五个方面进行创新，为小企业客户量身打造了11个专有产品。针对小企业抵押担保不足的问题，研发了“联保联贷”；为降低小企业融资成本，与小额贷款公司研发了“卖断型接力贷”；为优质小企业客户提供增值服务，推出了“增值贷”；为融资需求急小企业提供“快捷贷”；为解决小企业日常经营资金循环使用的问题，推出“循环贷”；为解决小企业初期购置固定资产遇到的资金瓶颈，推出了“法人按揭贷”；为减轻企业还款压力研发了“宽限期分期还款贷”；为满足客户灵活采购，推出自由组合、长短零整互换的“票据置换”；针对小企业主推出了以信用卡为载体的“小企业主增值贷”；针对特定的网络平台客户推出了“网络自助贷”；针对交易市场内小企业客户、依托交易市场、商场等商圈推出了“商圈贷”共11项产品。 据华夏银行相关人士介绍，目前，华夏银行小企业业务发展迅速，已为13.6万余户小企业提供全面金融服务。11月末，小企业贷款增量是2009年全年增量的2.18倍，增速高于全行贷款平均增速20.45个百分点，提前达到监管部门“两个不低于”的工作要求。2010年末小企业贷款余额将突破千亿元大关，小企业贷款占比不低于18.9%。 未来三年，华夏银行将紧紧围绕打造“中小企业金融服务商”的战略目标，从机制、人力、财务配置、绩效考核等方面进一步加大对小企业业务的资源倾斜；力争为20万的小企业客户提供全面金融服务，其中小企业贷款客户数不低于5万，小企业贷款占比不低于30%。 [编辑: 王好] 分享: 【 大 中 小 】【 rss订阅 】【 打印 】【 关闭 】 近日热点 市场预期年内或再加息 各大银行提前还贷潮涌现 2010 12/20 06:56 "年终工作总结"愁煞上班族 恶搞版网上疯传 2010 12/21 14:46 媒体称明起汽柴油每吨分别上调310元300元 2010 12/21 17:31 白领该去哪打拼 中国未来5大"聚宝地"(图) 2010 12/21 14:26 银行收费项目太多? 教你做"逃费达人" 2010 12/21 14:09 月供3000元 中年教师家庭如何过上无忧生活 2010 12/20 15:17 济南推出奢华圣诞大餐10万一桌 吃的不是饭 2010 12/20 15:41 80后硕士生回收废品 毕业前买车买房揽女友 2010 12/21 14:19 李宁进军体育地产受挫 市值一天内缩水30亿 2010 12/21 14:26 最牛购房者出书 与开发商死扛三年获赔(图) 2010 12/20 15:43

description.hltext_display: Mechtronic Solutions Takeover Completed
description.content:
National Technical Systems of California has completed acquisition of Mechtronic Solutions Inc., increasing its defense and aerospace business.
MSI, a privately held engineering services firm with headquarters in New Mexico, has annual revenues of about $7.5 million and an extensive customer base in the aerospace and defense industries.
The company is developing several airborne sensor systems for deployment on both manned aircraft and unmanned aircraft systems. Sensor systems designed and built by MSI have been deployed globally.
National Technical Systems said that under the leadership of its current management, MSI will continue to operate from its facilities in Albuquerque.
Terms of the transaction weren't disclosed.
"The addition of MSI to the NTS family significantly advances our full-service integrated engineering services capabilities and provides us with additional established customers in the aerospace and defense industries," NTS President and Chief Executive Officer William C. McGinnis said. "We now offer full product life-cycle support for a broad range of our customers' product engineering requirements, making NTS a true single-source solution.

event_or_fact.property: The addition of MSI to the NTS family significantly advances our full-service integrated engineering services capabilities and provides us with additional established customers in the aerospace and defense industries
President and Chief Executive Officer, National Technical Systems

description.hltext_display: China replaces senior Foreign Ministry official
description.content:
BEIJING—Official reports say China has replaced a senior Foreign Ministry official with a bureaucrat boasting deep ties to the Communist Party's foreign policy establishment.
The appointment comes at the end of a trying year for China's diplomacy as the country backs away from its long-standing low-key approach to territorial disputes and participation in global organizations.
The website of the party's People's Daily newspaper says Vice Foreign Minister Zhang Zhijun has taken over as the ministry's Communist Party secretary, a position that outranks the actual foreign minister.
Zhang, 57, served almost his entire career in the party's International Liaison Department, a type of shadow Foreign Ministry focussing on contacts with foreign political parties.

description.hltext_display: South Korea vows to 'punish enemy'
description.content:
South Korea has vowed to "punish the enemy" as hundreds of troops, fighter jets, tanks and attack helicopters prepared for massive new drills near the heavily armed border a month after a deadly North Korean artillery attack.
Although the North backed down from its threat to retaliate over South Korean drills on Monday in west coast waters claimed by both countries, South Korean forces have been on high alert this week, warning of surprise attacks.
The North responded to an artillery drill on South Korea's front-line Yeonpyeong Island on November 23 with an artillery bombardment that killed four, including two civilians.
The North has made some conciliatory gestures in recent days - telling a visiting US governor that it might allow international nuclear inspections of its atomic programs - but Seoul appears unmoved and is bracing for possible aggression.
"We will completely punish the enemy if it provokes us again like the shelling of Yeonpyeong Island," said Brig Gen Ju Eun-sik, chief of the army's 1st armoured brigade.
South Korea's navy has begun its annual four-day firing and anti-submarine exercises off the country's less-tense east coast.
The disputed western sea border has been the site of most of the Koreas' recent military skirmishes, including last month's artillery bombardment. But the east coast was used by the North as a submarine route for communist agents to infiltrate South Korea in the past.
Meanwhile, on Tuesday, a church illuminated a huge steel Christmas tree standing atop a South Korean peak that overlooks North Korean border towns, resuming a tradition condemned in Pyongyang as propaganda.
The lighting - which needed government permission - was a sign that President Lee Myung-bak's administration is serious about countering the North's aggression with measures of its own in the wake of the North's artillery bombardment. The North warned the tree could trigger bloodshed on the peninsula.
For decades, the rival Koreas have fought an ideological war, using leaflets, loudspeakers and radio broadcasts across the border. At the height of the propaganda, South Korea's military speakers blared messages near the border 20 hours a day, officials say.

description.hltext_display: 交通塞 雅� 達擬取消路邊停車
description.content:
交通塞 雅加達擬取消路邊停車 【16:35】
〔中央社〕印尼雅加達地方議會今天表示，雅加達的交通壅塞問題非常嚴重，解決之道就是實施分階段取消路邊停車，尤其要取締非法的路邊停車。
地方議會議員們同意，立刻取締非法的路邊停車，並計劃解決越來越嚴重的塞車問題，包括興建大量的停車場、增加公路的寬度及改善目前的停車制度。
議員們說，雅加達每年公路增加的長度只有0.01%，可是車輛的增加速度每年達9%。因此增加停車場的數量是取消路邊停車的最佳辦法。為了不損害廣大公路使用者的權益，雅加達地方政府，尤其是交通局，必須制定良好的措施，克服當前和未來的交通擁擠問題。（本文附有照片）

description.hltext_display: How to better manage consultants
description.content:
IT companies hire consulting firms to further the strategic, financial, and operational objectives of the CEO and their management team, but, too often the consultants manage the executives, instead of the other way around. Authors Gordon Perchthold and Jenny Sutton share their thoughts about consultant management. By Ross O. Storey
Tools sponsored by
Asia is a ‘buyer beware’ market, even with globally branded consulting firms, according to Gordon Perchthold and Jenny Sutton, authors of ‘Extract Value From Consultants: How to Hire, Control, and Fire Them’ (www.ExtractValueFromConsultants.com).
They say the management and IT consulting profession developed in the US but has been poorly adapted to Asia where transient partners fly in and out, western consultant training programmes are poorly adapted and local consultants are promoted faster than their capabilities and experience justify.
They maintain that the cultural diversity of countries in Asia makes it difficult to develop critical mass to deliver the right expertise to clients. Often, better results can be achieved, they believe, by configuring a consulting team based on individual specialists and boutique firms, but there are risks if basic principles are not followed.
Perchthold and Sutton stress that executives and managers need to understand the reality of how the consulting business works in Asia, how partners and consultant incentives support, or detract from, their client objectives, what are the appropriate roles for consultants, approaches to select and contract the right mix of consultants based on merit and value, techniques for proactively managing and controlling consultants to deliver greater business results, and practices to avoid undermining consultant productivity. They jointly responded to the following questions:
The title of your book seems to imply that this can be hard work. Do enterprises necessarily have to pressure consultants for them to deliver the best value and how do they apply this ‘extraction’ process?
Active involvement on the part of executives or managers is required to ensure that consultants deliver on their promises. The title also conveys our belief that the enterprise should be driving the relationship, rather than sitting back and simply responding to the consultants’ advances.
There is a clear correlation between the level of active involvement of enterprise personnel and the value obtained from using consultants, irrespective of how capable the consultants are. Enterprises do not necessarily have to ‘pressure consultants’ to deliver something, but they need to manage and control their consultants to deliver value defined by a specific business outcome.
What is the business environment in Asia on getting the best value from consultants? Are enterprises doing so or do consultants have the upper hand?
Dissatisfaction with consultants is a worldwide phenomenon. But in a way, this is not surprising as it is rare to see centralised, enterprise-wide accountability for ensuring that value is delivered by each consulting firm. Further, executives, managers, and employees are involved with consulting engagements irregularly, and seldom receive any training on how to manage and control consultants, and yet consultants manage their clients all day, every day—so the consultants invariably end up with the upper hand.
In Asia, we are surprised at how often enterprises buy consulting services on the strength of relationships, brand, nebulous promises, and the consulting firm’s track record in the West. The reality is that consulting in Asia is still an immature industry with transient Western consulting partners flying in and out for assignments, or on short-term expatriate postings, without fully understanding the context and environment in which they are advising.
Asia premium
The training curriculum for junior consultants is based on content and teaching methods devised in western markets without sufficient, if any, adaptation for the education foundation and manner in which people learn and effect change here in Asia. Combined with the frequent job-hopping of consultants in Asia for incremental gains in job titles and compensation, the result is that clients in Asia often pay at least one rate level higher for a consultant in Asia than they would for the equivalent experience and skill in the West—often for less delivered value.
What are the typical issues between enterprises and consultants and are there any specific challenges in Asia?
A typical problem we see is consultants that promise outcomes and results in their proposals, but when it comes to contracting they are reluctant to commit to these.
Another issue arises when after an enterprise has engaged a consulting firm for a project that is within the consulting firm’s core competency, they continue to use the same consulting firm over and over again for work that is less and less related to the original engagement.
This issue is pervasive in Asia given the importance attached to relationships (which consulting firms take full advantage of), and the perceived lack of alternatives. But in fact, few consulting firms in Asia have the multi-service capability spanning all functions, processes, and industries that is common in the West. The fragmentation created by the linguistic and cultural diversity of the region makes it very difficult for consulting firms to deliver multi-service capability in any one country, never mind multiple countries. That is exactly why enterprises should be evaluating other consulting firms for each new engagement. The problem with continually using the same consultants is that as they stray away from their core competency they deliver less and less value to the enterprise—they are often learning at the client’s expense.
What industry sectors in Asia are most fond of using consultants and how much in demand are IT consultants?
Kennedy Research predicts that consulting revenue in Asia will be US$57 billion by 2012. A large portion of these fees are earned in Japan, South Korea and Greater China. The industry sectors that spend the most on consulting globally are financial services and the public sector although in Asia, telecommunications as well as energy/utilities are frequent users of consultants as well.
In terms of function, while IT-related consulting accounts for a large percentage everywhere, in Asia, this is even more pronounced, contributing more than 70 per cent of consulting expenditure.
Note: Enterprise buyers, particularly outside Japan, need to be extremely careful about making selection decisions based solely on market data obtained from such information sources, or from the consulting firms themselves, about a particular firm’s scale in Asia.
We have noted significant variations in figures provided by firms such as Kennedy, Gartner, IBIS in terms of reported consulting revenue and spending in Asia.
This is probably due to a combination of different definitions and categorisations of services within the disparate collection of Asia consulting practices of the global consulting firms, the challenge of capturing data from the highly fragmented set of independent consultants, and the difficulty of obtaining the off-setting data from the users of consultants across the dispersed countries in Asia.
What are the three key elements of the enterprise - consultant relationship that senior executives need to be aware of and what are the traps they need to avoid?
• Do not buy the consulting pyramid: While projects are generally pyramidal in structure, not all the roles have to be filled by one consulting firm—it is far better to create an integrated team of enterprise staff, low-cost contractors, and selected consultants. This improves buy-in, access to information, builds internal capability, and reduces consulting fees.
• Pay for results not effort: Although consultants’ fees are usually estimated or quoted based on the hours they expect to work, actual payment of the agreed fee should be linked to results (milestones, deliverables, outcomes, measurable achievements) rather than hours worked.
• Improve internal capability to manage consultants: Enterprises need to adopt more sophisticated techniques for engaging and managing consultants—including taking the lead on writing any contracts (rather than working off the consultant’s contract), doing proper, independent post-engagement reviews, training staff on how to work effectively with consultants, and sharing lessons learnt from one project to the another.
What advice would you give to senior executives in Asia when it comes to hiring consultants? What key questions should they ask?
The bottom line, particularly in Asia, is that value is delivered by individuals, not the brand of the consulting firm. When a consulting firm presents their ‘qualifications’ page showing all their client names and logos, ask if the engagements for those clients were undertaken in Asia, who on the proposed team actually worked on those specific clients and what was the consultant’s role.
Executives should also interview the specific consultants that the consulting firm proposes to assign to the team to make sure that they are qualified for their roles. Then, the executives should make sure that the time commitment and duration they expect those consultants to be assigned to the project is included in the contract.
There is no point in spending the time to vet the team, only to find that the key people will be assigned part-time or for the first few weeks only. Remember, the consultant talent pool is very shallow in Asia—any substitutes for those hand-picked consultants will, almost certainly, be less qualified.
Gordon Perchthold and Jenny Sutton, with their own Asia-based firm, The RFP Company (www.RFPCompany.com ), have served in Asia for the past decade and for dozens of multinational clients across North America, Europe. They’ve been consultants or partners, in organisations such as Accenture, Deloitte, and ABeam Consulting (Japan).
Tags: Management & Careers

description.hltext_display: 打击通胀只是嘴上说说
description.content:
通胀数据统计的准确性存疑，令市场怀疑中国解决问题的决心。如果遏制通胀只是嘴上说说，其目的恐怕是为想让价格上升，抵销过去货币增长，同时不至于让债务人受苦，因为负债的主要是国有企业。美国、欧洲和中国三大经济体仍在试图蒙混过关，并希望通过拖延来解决诸多难题。这种做法正推动通胀至一个新的高度。
2
美国仍在不遗余力地进行财政和货币刺激，以解决经济困境：高失业，高负债，及庞大的财政和贸易赤字。这种做法的理由，是只要经济维持下去，问题会越变越小。这种观点认为，经济出问题，就像汽车抛锚。如果有人帮着推汽车，直到它自己打着火，问题将不复存在了。过去二十年中，人们都这么想，正是如此才导致了2008年的危机。让问题不断累积，直到最后汽车根本无法启动。前两年的大规模刺激手段效果不佳，美国人的反应是采用更多的刺激。这将导致另一场危机，也许就在未来这几年。
美国财政刺激的目的显而易见，就是想让奥巴马能在2012年连任。他们当然有可能达到目的。但如果要让美国经济能比较体面，令奥巴马得以连任，就需要有三个条件：新兴经济体继续通胀，维持了美国的出口；欧洲的主权债务危机支撑了美元的价值，抵销美联储的量化宽松；原油价格不会飙升，以减少美国刺激政策的效果。
但事情也可能不朝这些方向发展。今年12月，市场最重要的变化，是美国国债收益率上升了100个基点，国际原油价格超过了90美元/桶。这样的两个水平还不足以引发另一场危机。历史上平均的10年期国债收益率接近6%，目前是3.4%，还比较低。2008年，石油价格曾飙升至150美元/桶。只要国债收益率没超过历史平均水平，油价还没到2008年的高点，美联储还不至于惊慌。
不过，上述两种情况还是有可能在明年发生的。市场逐渐倾向于认为，美联储的真正目的是用货币化手段洗掉美国的债务。在这种情况下，美联储在鼓励美国政府，企业和家庭在短期内重新融资，而且不必担忧长期利率，因为即便美国国债市场崩盘，美联储也不会改变政策。但如果美元发生危机，美联储有可能改变政策，因为这意味着恶性通货膨胀。外国持有的美国国债依然数量巨大。如果外国投资者抛售美国国债，逃离美元，美联储大概没有胆量像1998年俄罗斯做的那样——通过恶性通胀违约。
美元得到了欧洲主权债务危机的支撑。2011年，欧洲很可能解决不了危机。如此一来，美元将得到支撑。美联储可能会实行第三轮、第四轮甚至更多的量化宽松政策，而不用担心后果。
美联储的理想状况是，美元逐步贬值，以反映美国的高通胀，及短期利率大大低于通胀率，也即负实际利率。如果美联储能在将5%的负实际利率保持十年，美国的负债可减少40%，会回到历史平均的水平上。
但是，如果欧洲能找到一个解决其主权危机的方案，例如，把救助基金增加一倍，美元有可能大幅贬值。石油价格将因此飙升。这对美国消费者来说，相当于加税，会抵销刚通过的财政刺激的效果。一旦美联储觉的其政策弊大于利，它可能改变政策。
欧洲需要清晰地说出其解决欧元区主权债务危机的做法。欧洲急需一个类似于美国联邦破产法第11章这样的机制(第11章“重组”的根本目的是拯救企业，使企业摆脱无力偿债的困境，重新恢复生机和活力。按照第11章的要求，企业将凭借未来收益支付部分或全部债务，而不是通过出售财产来支付。为此，第11章规定了一系列支持破产公司的条款，以增加其持续经营的可能性。债权人收回资金的努力被中止了，债务人企业将停止支付本金和利息，直到重组计划付诸实施。)。这个方法的症结在于债主们是否愿意放弃部分债权。由于欧洲银行，尤其是法国、德国和瑞士的银行持有大量主权债务危机国的债权，让它们放弃分债权可能引银行业危机。因此，欧元区必须同时解决上述两个问题。
欧元区比美国和日本都要健康。它的国际收支良好，国家和家庭债务水平要比英美低。虽然作出决定的速度慢，但它最终还是会做出决定。我很乐观地认为，欧元区债务危机会在2011年得到解决，如此一来，美元会遭受可怕的打击。
中国正嚷嚷要打击通胀，但暂时看起来，所谓的打击也只是嘴巴上说说。最近央行上调存款准备金率，即是为了展示决心。但央行在出售央票时不太顺。上调准备金率更像是央票替代品，只是更便宜些，而不是打击通胀的新手段。显然，这种数量型政策不太有效。银行系统外的信贷扩张弥补了系统内的收缩。令人费解的是，为何中国没有意识到这一点，改用利率政策呢。
通胀数据统计的准确性存疑，令市场怀疑中国解决问题的决心。如果遏制通胀只是嘴上说说，其目的恐怕是为想让价格上升，抵销过去货币增长，同时不至于让债务人受苦，因为负债的主要是国有企业。
美国、欧洲和中国的事情说明，三大经济体仍在试图蒙混过关，也即，不用太大动作即能稳定当前局势，并希望通过拖延来解决诸多难题。这种做法正推动通胀至一个新的高度。全球经济过渡到高通胀之路不可能一帆风顺，有些危机不可避免。

description.hltext_display: 提埃利斯阿帅就头疼 火箭犹如他的取分银行
description.content:
火箭121∶112勇士
昨天，火箭击败勇士，赛季首迎3连胜。
火箭此前11次对勇士胜出10次，唯一的失利是今年的揭幕战，那场比赛埃利斯狂� �46分。在埃利斯眼里，火箭犹如取分的银行一� �，在火箭头上刷刷数据，简直是小菜一碟。此战，首节他一人攻下11分，第3节结束后个人得分已升到30+。火箭虽然挡不住� 所不能的“埃疯子”，但全队的进攻很给力。尤其三分线，火箭此役24投11中，其中巴蒂尔6投4中，马丁4投3中，洛瑞3投2中。要知道12月份的比赛，火箭三分命中率高达46%，位居联盟第一。 火箭在前3节略� 上风，但最后一节风云突变，埃利斯再次不断� �分，而火箭在本节打了近5分钟只投中两球。眼看又要出现崩盘趋势，马丁适时站了出来——罚球、上篮、三分、大力灌篮，4分钟内攻下9分，末节一人得到17分，最终助火箭获胜。
全场比赛，马丁贡献30分、5个篮板，斯科拉20分、9个篮板、6次助攻，继续替补登场的小布得到5分。勇士的埃利斯拿下44分，大卫·李19分。
提埃利斯阿帅就头疼
埃利斯可以说是全联盟最让火箭头疼的家伙了，上一次对火箭得到46分，他昨天又� �下44分。赛后，阿德尔曼� 奈地说：“� 论怎么布置，我们就是挡不住他。” 赛后被问及埃利斯时，阿帅的脸上立刻露出苦笑，“我不知道，我们让他两次做到这一点（得分40+），这（对他）是个成就。我们想阻止他跳投和突� �，但他还是都做到了，我们有些� 可奈何”。 布鲁克斯和洛瑞在一起打了一段时间，阿帅表示双控卫会持续下去，“上赛季他们打过，我们有3个组织后卫，我想看看他们两个的组合。当他们表现都很好时，就能给对手� 成很大威胁”。

description.hltext_display: 清议：上调成品油价格利好2011年国内股市预期
description.content: 中国经济网北京12月22讯 昨日，清议发表题为《价格是管理需求的工具》的博文。文章指出，今年第三次上调成品油价格意义非同小可。此次上调成品油价格，有助于明年的宏观经济稳健增长，关于明年国内股市预期是一项重要的利好因素。 文章认为，此次上调成品油价格的特殊背景在于不断强化的通胀预期，尤其是此前高调出台的价格干预政策。既然大多数经济学家不看好价格干预政策的前景，担心过度的行政干预将导致经济再次出现剧烈收缩，那么，此次上调成品油价格，应当被视为一项利好，有助于明年的宏观经济稳健增长。 文章指出，此次上调成品油价格能够成为一个积极的政策信号，借助市场手段而不是行政手段，在实现供需平衡的前提下走出通胀预期。想当年，如果不坚持市场化方向，允许彩电价格随行就市，绝不会在有效刺激国内产能扩张的情况下将五、六千元一台的21寸彩电价格压迫至后来的千元以下。 文章分析，关于明年国内股市预期，上调成品油价格被看作是一项重要的利好因素。预计今后6周此项利好将与加息预期降温一道成为市场多头的主要依据。 博文地址：http://blog.sina.com.cn/s/blog_4a46559f01017504.html?tj=1 作者简介： 清议：恒泰证券首席经济学家。 [编辑: 王好] 分享: 【 大 中 小 】【 rss订阅 】【 打印 】【 关闭 】 近日热点 市场预期年内或再加息 各大银行提前还贷潮涌现 2010 12/20 06:56 "年终工作总结"愁煞上班族 恶搞版网上疯传 2010 12/21 14:46 媒体称明起汽柴油每吨分别上调310元300元 2010 12/21 17:31 白领该去哪打拼 中国未来5大"聚宝地"(图) 2010 12/21 14:26 银行收费项目太多? 教你做"逃费达人" 2010 12/21 14:09 月供3000元 中年教师家庭如何过上无忧生活 2010 12/20 15:17 济南推出奢华圣诞大餐10万一桌 吃的不是饭 2010 12/20 15:41 80后硕士生回收废品 毕业前买车买房揽女友 2010 12/21 14:19 李宁进军体育地产受挫 市值一天内缩水30亿 2010 12/21 14:26 最牛购房者出书 与开发商死扛三年获赔(图) 2010 12/20 15:43

description.hltext_display: FBU Welcomes Decision to Scrap Regional Fire Control Project
description.content: GATESHEAD, UNITED KINGDOM--(Marketwire - Dec. 22, 2010) - North East news desks: The release of a written ministerial statement by Fire Minister Bob Neill announcing the end of the FiReControl Project was welcomed by the Fire Brigades Union in the North East. The project that would have seen the four local emergency fire control rooms close and replaced with one regional call centre in Durham has been terminated with immediate effect following acceptance by Government and the main contractor Cassidian (formerly EADS) that the requirements of the project cannot be met. This decision follows years of delays and missed deadlines, together with spiralling costs.The Fire Brigades Union (FBU) refused to accept claims made by Government that the project would lead to greater resilience, cost savings and improved efficiency. Over the past 7 years fire service professionals within the Union have expressed concerns at the deliverability of such a project and believed claims of such benefits were exaggerated.In his announcement on the 20th December, the Fire Minister identified that "progress on the project had caused serious concerns", earlier in the year the Minister had made it clear to the main contractor that the IT system had to be delivered to time, cost and quality. What is apparent from this announcement is that project requirements were not going to be fulfilled by Cassidian.North East FBU Regional Secretary Pete Wilcox said "Common sense has finally prevailed and we will now see an end to good money being thrown after bad. This project was never going to deliver on expectations and it is a decision that should and could have been made a long time ago. We have witnessed valuable tax payers money wasted on a project that should never have seen the light of day. The amount of money squandered on the regionalisation agenda for emergency fire control rooms could have been invested productively in the fire service resulting in real improvements to service delivery in the communities we serve. It is important that we now see a measured response by the Government and Fire and Rescue Services ensuring we see investment in a structure known to work, with solutions delivered that continue to ensure all fire services have suitable and effective mobilising systems. This will be a difficult challenge given the cuts agenda being imposed by the Government across the public sector but one we can not fail to meet."

event_or_fact.property: Common sense has finally prevailed and we will now see an end to good money being thrown after bad.; This project was never going to deliver on expectations and it is a decision that should and could have been made a long time ago. We have witnessed valua

description.hltext_display: Lake City awarded money for streetcar study
description.content:
The Salt Lake Tribune
Updated 40 minutes ago Updated Dec 22, 2010 12:52AM
On the heels of snatching federal cash for the planned Sugar House streetcar, Salt Lake City has been awarded more money from Washington — this time to explore alignment options for streetcars downtown.
The Federal Transit Administration (FTA) has allotted $470,000 for a Redevelopment Agency feasibility study. Utah’s capital was one of 24 winners among 67 bids in the nationwide competition for $25.7 million, according to the Mayor’s Office.
Since taking office in 2008, Mayor Ralph Becker has promoted the idea of introducing streetcars to crisscross downtown’s Central Business District and connect to TRAX and FrontRunner stations. The mayor has led city delegations and business leaders to the Pacific Northwest on fact-finding missions for streetcars.
The latest grant is not nearly enough to fund an actual downtown system, but will pay for the necessary “alternatives analysis.” The FTA cited the city’s sustainability and redevelopment goals in awarding the grant.
“With this funding from the FTA, we take a giant step towards development of our downtown streetcar system,” Becker said in a news release. “With a daytime population that doubles every day, the City Creek development under way and the expansive growth of our downtown core in Salt Lake City, the timing of this funding to increase our transit options couldn’t be better.”
The downtown study area stretches from 500 East to 600 West between South Temple and 900 South. No firm decisions have been made about where to route the streetcars. But city planners like the idea of using them to complete a so-called “circulator” with TRAX.
The city was awarded $26 million in federal funds for the Sugar House streetcar in October. That line is expected to traverse an abandoned rail corridor between 2100 South and Interstate 80 from the Central Pointe TRAX Station to McClelland Street near the Sugar House business district. The line could be complete by early 2012.
There is no timetable — and as yet no funding — for a downtown streetcar network

description.hltext_display: 戈登38分� �里芬准三双 快船� 狼取得三连胜
description.content:
北京时间12月21日，洛杉矶快船队在主场以113-90大胜明尼苏达森林狼队取得三连胜，森林狼队遭遇六连败。
快船队的戈登得到36分、6次助攻和5次抢断，去年的状元秀� �里芬依然霸道，他得到22分10个篮板和7次助攻，莱恩-戈麦斯得到22分和10个篮板，德安德鲁-乔丹得到9分和9个篮板，法鲁克-阿米努得到9分和7个篮板，巴朗-戴维斯得到8分和12次助攻。
森林狼队的迈克尔-比斯利得到20分和4个篮板，马特尔-韦伯斯特得到18分和5个篮板，凯文-勒夫得到12分和10个篮板，卢克-里德诺得到10分和6次助攻。 森林狼4-0领先进入比赛。戴维斯与� �里芬联手攻下5分给予还击，双方比分交替上升一度杀成13平。比斯利连续� �分反超快船，双方的进攻效率都非常不错，首节比赛主场的快船34-31领先。韦伯斯特替补上篮帮助森林狼追分，两队打成39平。布莱索与戈登轮翻冲击森林狼防线，半场结束前最后1分钟快船打出6-0的攻势，从而在半场 68-58领先。
比斯利在第三节的进攻熄火，乐福虽然找到进攻节奏，� 奈双拳难敌四手，快船全线开火将优势扩大到86-69，森林狼在第三节兵败如山倒，三节比赛结束的时候快船94-79遥遥领先，末节比赛里森林狼追分的希望早早被快船粉碎，主场的快船最终以113-90大胜。
森林狼队首发阵容：里德诺、约翰逊、比斯利、勒夫、米利西奇
快船队首发阵容：戴维斯、戈登、戈麦斯、� �里芬、德安德鲁-乔丹

description.hltext_display: 최� 8.6%...`통큰 배당` 주인공은?
description.content:
[한네트 등 6개사, 5%이상 시가배당률 제공… 시세차익+배당수익 `일석이조`]
연말을 맞이해 `통큰 배당`을 제시하는 종목들이 속속 등장하고 있다.
시세차익과 함께 배당수익까지 노릴수 있는 투자자들은 신이 났다.
22일 금융감독원·한국거래소에 따르면 이달 들어 현금배당 공시를 내놓은 종목은 코스피 10종목, 코스닥 51종목 등 총 61개 종목에 이른다. 이들 종목의 평균 시가배당률은 2.42%이지만 종목별 편차는 컸다.
가장 높은 시가배당률을 제시한 종목은 코스닥시장에 상장된 한네트였다.
금융단말시스템 등을 제조하는 한네트는 지난 14일 공시를 통해 보통주 1주당 250원씩 현금배당을 실시하기로 했다고 밝혔다. 시가배당률은 8.62%에 이른다. 시중은행 1년 정기예금 금리(2~4%선)은 물론 국내 저축은행의 1년 정기예금 평균금리(5.10%)보다도 높다.
한네트 주가는 올 1월4일 2450원에서 이달 22일 3000원으로 22.4% 올랐다. 올 초부터 한네트 주식을 보유하고 있었던 주주는 주가상승으로 인한 시세차익에 더해 별도의 배당수익까지 거머쥘 수 있게 된 셈이다. 한네트는 총 28억9000만원을 현금배당으로 지급할 예정이다. 지난해 당기순이익(70억원)의 41.3%에 달하는 규모다.
코스피 상장사 중에서는 한미반도체가 가장 높은 시가배당률을 제시하고 있다. 한미반도체는 지난 8일 보통주 1주당 500원씩 총 127억원을 현금배당하기로 했다고 밝혔다. 시가배당률은 6.28%에 달한다.
이밖에 크린앤사이언스(6.42%) 브리지텍(6.2%) 후너스(5.28%) 리노공업(5.1%) 등 6개사가 5%대 이상의 시가배당률을 제시했다.
인화정공(4.4%) 한국트로닉스(4.4%) 인포바인(4.31%) 진양제약(4.3%) 상신브레이크(4.1%) 등이 4%대, 에스피지(3.67%) 이상네트웍스(3.39%) 등은 3%대의 시가배당률을 각각 제시했다.
전문가들은 이미 3분기 말부터 배당주에 대한 관심증가로 주가가 많이 올랐지만 배당주 투자가 늦지 않았다고 말하고 있다.
백효원 솔로몬투자증권 연구원은 "배당주는 저금리와 시장의 낮은 주가수익비율(PER)이 맞물릴 때 매력적"이라며 "최근 상승장 때문에 시장 전체의 PER이 다소 높아졌지만 과도하게 높다고 볼 수는 없는 수준"이라고 말했다.
또 "연말이라 하더라도 배당주는 안정적 수익과 자본수익까지 얻을 수 있기 때문에 투자하기 늦지 않았다"며 "중형 대형 종목 중에서 현금을 많이 보유한 곳, 필수소비재 섹터 등 전통적으로 배당을 많이 실시한 업종 등을 주목할 필요가 있다"고 덧붙였다.
[황국상기자 gshwang@]

description.hltext_display: 元旦起月房贷要多交 房奴热议还贷省钱新招
description.content: 12月20日，市民李先生去银行ATM机上存了3500元，还了今年最后一次房贷。从下个月开始，由于加息因素，他每个月的还款金额将上升100元左右。而随着房地产调控措施的出台和银行贷款的收紧，目前不少市民表示已经很难申请到房贷，更不要说拿到利率优惠了。因此，在高通胀的今天，各种“省钱攻略”也在“房奴”中间悄悄流传开来。 本报记者 周? 新招之1 变更还款方式 “省钱新招”里，有一条是“变等额本息还款为等额本金还款”。据了解，目前更多房贷客户选择的是等额本息还款方式，即按按揭贷款的本金总额与利息总额相加，然后平均分摊到还款期限的每个月中，还款人每月还给银行固定金额。 “省钱攻略”称，在利率长期保持稳定的情况下，等额本息更合算；但在加息预期之下，由于等额本金还款方式在初期偿还较大款项，但利息总负担相对较少，所以改为等额本金还款可节约不少支出。 记者询问银行得知，目前大部分银行允许贷款者转换还款方式。但这种“省钱招数”并不是对每个客户都适用。比如在还款初期，选择等额本金还款，每个月相对需偿还更多金额，客户应考虑自己的经济承受能力，避免因还款压力大而影响生活。 新招之2 固定房贷利率 “省钱攻略”称，若能固定房贷利率，便可锁定房贷成本。所谓固定利率房贷，即在贷款期限内，不论银行利率如何变动，借款人都将按合同规定的固定利率支付利息。但实际上，据记者了解，这种做法的可行性并不强。由于加息预期明显升温，浮动利率房贷业务的利息收入超过固定利率房贷，因此出于盈利角度的考虑，沪上多家银行已暂停固定利率房贷。少数仍有固定利率房贷的银行，或是调高了业务门槛，或是将利息设得很高，甚至比普通房贷高出1个百分点以上，让客户望而却步。 据业内人士分析，购房者需要谨慎选择浮动利率转固定利率。固定利率更适合对未来的支出有一个精确规划，或是对未来利率变动有着理智认识的投资者。 新招之3 不必急于还贷 还有一些市民则表示，在通货膨胀的背景下，钱越来越“不值钱”，“贷到等于是赚到。”特别是随着房地产调控措施的出台和银行贷款的收紧，房贷申请已经越来越难，对手头已申请到的房贷应该多加珍惜，“还掉之后想再贷就难了”。 2008年10月27日，央行曾宣布将房贷利率下限由基准利率的0.85倍下调至0.7倍。但这样的好光景已经一去不复返，今年10月下旬，沪上银行相继取消了首套房贷利率7.5折优惠。日前更有消息称，部分沪上银行已完全取消首套房贷优惠，即便是首套房贷也必须实行基准利率。在这样的背景下，那些已经申请到7折、8折利率优惠的房贷客户更是可以慢慢还款，如果提前还掉，等于是做“亏本生意”。 【银行提醒】 银行人士提醒市民，由于目前大部分处于还贷期的客户基本属于“次年调整”，明年1月1日起将执行新利率。对于习惯在卡内存入固定数额的市民来说，还房贷时应存入足够的金额，以免信用记录受损。 [编辑: 王好] 分享: 【 大 中 小 】【 rss订阅 】【 打印 】【 关闭 】 近日热点 市场预期年内或再加息 各大银行提前还贷潮涌现 2010 12/20 06:56 "年终工作总结"愁煞上班族 恶搞版网上疯传 2010 12/21 14:46 媒体称明起汽柴油每吨分别上调310元300元 2010 12/21 17:31 白领该去哪打拼 中国未来5大"聚宝地"(图) 2010 12/21 14:26 银行收费项目太多? 教你做"逃费达人" 2010 12/21 14:09 月供3000元 中年教师家庭如何过上无忧生活 2010 12/20 15:17 济南推出奢华圣诞大餐10万一桌 吃的不是饭 2010 12/20 15:41 80后硕士生回收废品 毕业前买车买房揽女友 2010 12/21 14:19 李宁进军体育地产受挫 市值一天内缩水30亿 2010 12/21 14:26 最牛购房者出书 与开发商死扛三年获赔(图) 2010 12/20 15:43

description.hltext_display: 论默契热火怎比得上小牛 连胜终止波什郁闷
description.content:
小牛98∶96热火
昨天，热火以2分之差憾负小牛，12连胜就此终结。不过，三巨头里只有波什感到郁闷。
热火开局很糟，上来就吃到小牛14比2的攻击波。詹姆斯（19分）状态很一般，上半场竟未得分。终场前56.8秒，小皇帝打成2+1，将比分追成90比91。不过，波什随后错失一个中投，热火最终� 力回天。 赛后，波什（19分、8个篮板）有些自责，一人裸着上身、摊开双腿坐在更衣柜前发呆，“即使打到最后，我们仍有机会，但是开局太差了”。主帅斯波尔斯特拉点评说：“小牛在最后时刻的表现比我们更好。”小牛主帅卡莱尔很冷静，“我觉得连胜没有什么太重要的，我们只是想赢球，证明能做到踏踏实实拿下每一场比赛。我们可以”。 詹姆斯倒看得开，“比赛就是这� �，不管� 赛前练得多苦，还得看临场发挥。对手的防守让我们失衡了，就是这么简单”。热火本场快攻得分很少，是否� 为疲劳？小皇帝笑道：“哥们儿，从� 的语气中我反倒觉得� 累了，别忘睡觉啊。”轮到韦德（22分、7次助攻）发言，他好像已把对小牛14连败放在脑后，“我们才打了近30场，而他们在一起配合很久了。不过，这一整年，我们都会继续变得更好，提高实力。我们目� �就是成为顶尖强队，而我感觉现在和任何一支强队打季后赛，都能扛7场”。

description.hltext_display: 예금 1조2000억원이 대출금인지 여부, 어떤 조건으로 대출했는지 여부에 대해 여러 의혹을 받아왔다. 현대그룹은 끝내 대출계약서 � �출을 거부하면서 MOU가 해지되는 사태를 맞았� , 이후 프
description.content:
[이데일리 안재만 기자] 하종선 현대그룹(현대상선(011200)) 전략기획본부 사장은 프랑스 나티시스 은행으로부터 빌린 1조2000억원이 브릿지론이라고 확인했다.
하 사장은 22일 서울 서초구 중앙지방법원에서 열린 `양해각서(MOU) 해지 금지 가처분 신청` 첫 심리가 끝난 뒤 기자들과 만나 "나티시스은행에서 빌린 1조2000억원은 일각의 예상대로 브릿지론이 맞다"면서 "브릿지론은 해외 대형 M&A에서 일반적으로 나타나는 형태"라고 밝혔다.
브릿지론은 일시적으로 자금을 연결하는 다리(Bridge)가 되는 대출(Loan)을 뜻한다. 추후 유상증자를 통해 2조원을 조달하기로 계획을 세우고, 이에 앞서 채권단으로부터 자금 조달 능력을 인정받기 위해 브릿지론을 받은 것으로 추정된다.
앞서 현대그룹은 현대상선 프랑스법인의 예금 1조2000억원이 대출금인지 여부, 어떤 조건으로 대출했는지 여부에 대해 여러 의혹을 받아왔다. 현대그룹은 끝내 대출계약서 제출을 거부하면서 MOU가 해지되는 사태를 맞았고, 이후 프랑스법인을 통해 국제적투자자들로부터 2조원 규모의 유상증자를 추진하겠다는 입장을 밝힌 바 있다.
하 사장은 "대출금과 함께 넥스젠 등 유럽계 투자자, 중동 및 미국 투자자로부터 2조원을 조달하는 방안을 마련 중"이라며 "애초에 현대상선 프랑스법인을 특수목적회사(SPC)로 쓰기 위해 컨소시엄에 참여시켰던 것"이라고 설명했다.
이에 앞서 현대그룹측 변호인은 심리에서 "나티시스은행과 넥스젠은 처음부터 현대건설 인수전에 함께 나설 생각이었다"면서 "다만 연대보증에 대한 부담 때문에 대출 방식으로 변경한 것이며, 보증이나 담보는 절대 없다"고 강조했다.
현대그룹은 또 본안소송에서 대출계약서를 제출하기로 약속했다. 대리인은 "나티시스은행과 협의를 맺고 대출계약서를 제출하도록 할 것"이라고 말했다.
한편 현대그룹은 이날 열린 첫 신문기일에서 `MOU 해지 및 SPA계약 거부의 불법성`, `대출계약서 제출 요구 부당` 등을 집중적으로 문제 제기했다. 재판부는 24일 오후 2시 358호 법정에서 심문기일을 한 차례 더 열기로 했다.
▶ 관련기사 ◀
＜ⓒ종합 경제정보 미디어 이데일리 - 무단전재&재배포 금지＞

description.hltext_display: State receives dismal grades in serving Californiaâs children
description.content:
Just as children across the state receive grades based on their scholastic achievements, the State of California is graded by the Children Now organization on its work serving the needs of the state’s youngest residents.
This year, the nonprofit organization that advocates making children a public policy priority, gave California a mostly negative review in the areas of education, health and cross-system issues. Children Now also released “The Children’s Agenda,” a list of the top 10 high-priority actions the group believes California policymakers should take to reverse the declining status of children.
The list includes comprehensive reform of the preschool to grade 12 education system; implementing an early learning and development system for all children from birth to age five; establishing a data system that connects early learning and development through higher education, health, juvenile justice and child welfare; and providing every California child with affordable health coverage and access to quality care.
“The question isn’t should we do these things; it’s why haven’t we done them,” said Ted Lempert, Children Now president. “For children to get the level of attention they so desperately need, especially during this difficult economic time, we have to ramp up children’s advocacy. ‘The Children’s Agenda’ serves as the necessary and time-sensitive first step.”
Under the category of education, Children Now gave California a “C-“ in early learning and development, a “D” in K-12 and the state’s only above average grade, a “B+” in afterschool.
Children Now states California’s K-12 system is failing far too many children. “At the same, California schools continue to be chronically underfunded; 2010-11 funding for education is estimated to be $4.1 billion below the ‘minimum constitutional guarantee’ approved by voters,” reads the report.
The one positive note in the report is California’s afterschool programs. Children Now recognizes that California is a national leader in state-funded afterschool programs, while stating that many schools still do not offer afterschool opportunities despite the research that has found these programs positively impact student achievement.
In the category of health, California received a “D+” in health coverage and asthma; a “D” in oral health, a “C” in mental health and a “C+” in both infant health and adolescent health.
Children Now sees health as the foundation for every child’s physical, emotional, cognitive and social development. The report found that California is at a crossroads on children’s health. Prior to the recession, California was making progress toward improving children’s health, reads the report. But now, with the ongoing state budget crisis and more and more Californians losing their jobs — and their health benefits — children are not getting the healthcare they need.
According to Children Now, California did not fare too well in the cross-system issues category either, rating a “D” in integrated services, a “C-“ in obesity and a “D+” in safety.
In support of their “D” grade for integrated services, Children Now cited that only 2 percent of California’s 332,825 children under age three living in poverty receive educational, health, nutritional and social services they are eligible for offered by the Early Head Start program. And 40 to 70 percent of children in California’s juvenile justice system have some form of mental health disorder or illness, yet only 16 percent have an open mental health case.
In their report on safety, Children Now stated that too many students are bullied at school and then face gang violence in the community.
The report comes as new leadership takes office in the Legislature and California welcomes a new governor. Lempert urged the new leaders to do a “better job of working with the facts and representing children’s best interests.”
“Clearly, any sound plan to revitalize our state must prioritize children’s development,” he said. “California’s history backs this up, as do countless examples from across the country and around the world.”
To contact Kristina Hacker, e-mail khacker@turlockjournal.com or call 634-9141 ext. 2004.

event_or_fact.property: the new leaders to do a ?better job of working with the facts and representing children?s best interests.? ?Clearly, any sound plan to revitalize our state must prioritize children?s development,? he said
?The question isn?t should we do these things; it?s why haven?t we done them,?
too many students are bullied at school and then face gang violence in the community.

description.hltext_display: Class makes dresses for Salvation Army
description.content:
Pitman High School students in Anne Cornell’s fashion and design class learned the value of community service this semester. Thirty-six students sewed 30 little girls’ Christmas dresses and donated them to the Salvation Army. Major Debi Shrum of the Salvation Army said the dresses will be distributed to families with young daughters during the holiday food distribution, and they would probably all be gone by the end of the week.
“Thank you all for doing this. A lot of these girls do not have new clothes and wouldn’t otherwise have a nice dress,” Shrum said to the students.
Cornell said her class has been donating Christmas and Easter dresses to the Salvation Army since Pitman High School opened. The Kiwanis Club of Turlock donates the fabric, which they buy from Cloth and Quilt for a special discounted price.

event_or_fact.property: the dresses will be distributed to families with young daughters during the holiday food distribution, and they would probably all be gone by the end of the week

Hafslund Fibernett äger och driver Norges största oberoende optiska fibernät som bland annat täcker Osloregionen, enligt ett pressmeddelande.

description.hltext_display: 大将军走了大伙都得拼 山猫变成奇才出气筒
description.content:
山猫75∶108奇才
虽然易建联和沃尔休战，但奇才昨天还是在主场狂扫山猫。
此战，奇才打出久违的团队篮球，上场球员全有得分，首发5人得分均上双。上半场奇才仅领先5分，但第3节他们净胜20分，一举� 定胜局。赛后，主帅桑德斯谈起后阿里纳斯时代的奇才，“以前球员都� 惯站着看阿里纳斯进攻和投篮，现在他走了，大家要学着多做一些事。尼克·杨做得不错，他对新角色完成得非常好”。
新交易来的刘易斯并未登场，他赛前表示既然到了奇才，就会认真对待，迎接新的挑战。“从一支争� 球队来到一支重建中的球队，我的目� �当然会改变。”刘易斯说，“我现在的目� �是帮球队找到进入季后赛的机会，在更衣室里帮队友进一步丰富经验。我不是要成为发号施令的领袖，而是要在大多数时候成为榜� �。”

description.hltext_display: 2010哪些投资帮你跑赢了CPI
description.content: 5.1%，是上周国家统计局公布的11月CPI的涨幅，这一数据也创下了28个月以来的新高。面对新一轮的物价上涨，人们在感慨价格上涨带来的压力时，还创造出了“蒜你狠”、“豆你玩”、“姜你军”等网络新词。所谓开源节流，省钱固然重要，但增加收入才是上上之策。看清历史才能更好地把握未来，在即将过去的2010年，大宗商品、黄金、楼市和股市等投资，哪些跟上了CPI上涨的步伐？ A股振幅高达40%震荡市赚钱不易 股市无疑是投资者参与程度最高的市场。2010年，沪深A股最大的特点就是震荡加剧。 炒股三年多的股民张海抱怨说，“今年老是把握不好节奏，4月份好不容易累计的20%利润，在5月份的猛烈下跌中全部吐了回去，连本金也损失了不少。现在好不容易才保本。” 张海的经历是不少股民在2010 年股市的缩影。截至12月20日，上证指数收于2852.92点，较2010年首个交易日(1月4日)的开盘价3289.75下跌了424.22点，跌幅为12.94%，但其间的振幅超过了40%。投资策略： 在恶性通胀期，投资机会会减少，这时需要选择一些跟CPI关系的不大的行业，比如科技创新、医药类行业。 半数基金跑赢CPI私募基金更抢眼 今年公募基金和私募基金的表现都强于大盘。截至12月15日，今年以来642只阳光私募基金平均净值回报为8.03%，且有481只私募基金实现了逆市飘红，占比超过75%。其中阳光私募中收益最好的“世通1期”，今年的收益率高达92.66%。其次是泽熙瑞金1号、混沌2号、理成风景2号等阳光私募产品，其收益也超过50%。而公募基金的平均收益高达7.11%，其中跑得最快的华商基金增长率为45.75%，虽然战果不俗，与阳光私募相比仍是差距不小。投资策略： 数据显示，从2006年开始定投中小板指数，收益好于沪深300指数。截至2010年4月12日，其年化收益率为30.77%。投资者每个月定投2000元，合计投入10.2万元，实际就可以获得19.07万元。“对于非专业投资者，基金定投是最合适的投资工具。”投资专家陈御建议说。 65%的投连险收益抵不上一年期存款利息 据统计，从去年12月31日起到今年11月15日，纳入观测的30多家寿险公司240个投连险账户收益中，只有9个账户的收益率超过10%，75个投连险账户的投资收益为负，占比达到31%，有38个投连险账户的投资收入不到1%，45个投连险账户的投资收益没有达到一年期的银行存款利率 2.25%-2.5%。投资策略： 分析人士指出，如果在本次大跌之前能够适当地调整账户金额，那么投资者面临的投资损失会比较小。投连险是二次投资，在投资之后，投资者还应该根据资本市场的变化来进行资金调整。 十年涨九倍涨势虽好但不易变现过去十年黄金价格涨了四倍，而拉菲涨了9倍。2000年的拉菲今年的价格已经涨到3.6万元/瓶，比去年上涨40%。 谢国忠指出，过去的十年，黄金价格已经涨了4倍。2000年产的拉菲价格上涨幅度是黄金的两倍――价格同期上涨了9倍。按重量计算，即使是低等的拉菲也比银价高得多，而1982年的拉菲这类高等货，价格是银的十倍。如果下一个十年拉菲仍然 可以保持这个状态，那么上等拉菲按重量折算后将与黄金一样贵。投资策略： 疯狂的拉菲真的能成为新的理财替代品吗？业内人士认为，顶级红酒变现渠道比较少，目前顶级红酒收藏投资多在红酒爱好者“圈内人”之间交流，普通投资者因资金、保存条件等所限，贸然投资红酒比较难赚到高利润，很多时候都是处于有价无市的状态。 黄金涨幅高达26%牛市因素依然在 2010年是黄金的大牛市，金价从新年的第一个交易日1月4日的1099开始上涨，随后一鼓作气地突破了1100，1200，1300，1400等关口，并在12月7日创下了1430.2美元/盎司的历史新高。截至12月20日，金价收于1386美元/盎司，年涨幅高达26%，而白银的涨幅更是惊人，高达76%，把CPI远远地甩在了身后。 中国黄金行业协会副会长张炳南表示，目前形成黄金牛市的因素包括国 际大宗商品持续看涨、全球投资黄金热情不减、各国信用危机依然存在、货币金融体系重建等等。目前形成黄金牛市的因素依然存在。投资策略： 世元金行分析师王舒认为，此轮黄金牛市仍有很好的基本面支撑，后市中长线仍有很好的投资机会。“未来金价可能会先回调到较强的支撑位，到时再择机入场做多，仍然可以继续赶上此轮黄金牛市的脚步。” 受房贷新政影响购房投资门槛被提高 自古以来房地产就是“硬通货”，这也是很多人的防通胀策略的第一反应。成思危说，现在的土地、建材、人工都在涨价，长期看房价还会涨。 在通胀周期中，房价的确有希望随通胀一同上涨。但随着地产新政的推出，二套房首付五成，利率上浮10%，第三套房停止放贷。在史上最严格的房贷新政下，就算房价会上涨，但要一次性拿出这么多真金白银，任何家庭在购买之前可能都会稍微掂量掂量。 投资策略： 任何投资都有风险，买房也不是万无一失的。谢国忠认为，许多人通过买房来对抗通胀，理论上是可行的。现在，一方面是人们对通胀的恐惧，总觉得钱会变得不值钱，但房子是不会贬值的，因此不断重复这个循环，但一旦没有足够的流动资金来喂饱这头野兽时，泡沫就要破裂了。那什么情况会刺激这个破裂的出现呢？谢国忠表示，现在普遍的观点是美元要贬值，人民币汇率还要升，但如果哪一天人民币升势掉头了，房价就要跌了。 记者手记 负利率时代该如何理财 如果在过去一年，你既没有买房又没有炒股，连基金也没有买一份，而只把钱存在了银行里，你会发现自己的财富不但没有增加，反而随着物价的上涨缩水了。这也就是所谓的存款实际收益为“负”的负利率的现象。 我们算个账，看看负利率到底是如何吞噬我们的财富的：根据国家统计局公布的数据显示，11月CPI同比上涨5.1%，创下28个月以来新高。而目前一年期定期存款的利率是2.5%。如果他存了1万块钱的话，一年之后算上利息一共是10250元。但是考虑到通货膨胀率，1万块钱一年之后膨胀变成了10510元。这么算下来的话，1万块钱一年就赔了260块钱。 存钱真的“越存越穷”？又该如何规避？ 扩大收入的办法有两个，一是开源，二是节流。在中国人的传统观念里，似乎更倾向于节流，而且节流更符合“勤俭持家”的传统美德。要让中国人多多开源也不是不易，“你不理财财不理你”这句话很多人都知道，但真正落实起来，各种各样的理由就出现：我搞不懂、没时间、银行的理财经理都是为了业绩，而并非真正为客户着想……如果您一直这样，那么有个现实你不得不面对――你放在银行或者家里的钱，每时每刻都是减少。 面对通胀，当您开始意识到投资理财的重要性时，不妨先从三个方面开始入手：主动出击，了解理财知识，养成理财习惯。现在各家银行针对中小储户推出的3个月、6个月的固定收益类投资产品，收益率在2.6%至2.8%之间，均高过一年期定存，但是很多老百姓并不清楚。建议广大消费者通过财经媒体、专业的金融部门以及理财师了解相关的理财知识，树立长期理财的观念；借助专业机构，制定多元化的理财计划。当投资者手中有相对宽裕的资金、同时又要面临未来教育、医疗、养老等多方面开支的时候，就可以求助于专业的理财机构。专业的理财机构用客观的评价体系作出“理财诊断”，为客户作出多元化的财务配置方案。 作出投资决策。商业机构给出的意见仅供参考，最后的决策还必须由投资者自己做出，在充分了解自身的财务情况以及理财偏好的基础上，投资者可以作出符合自身情况的投资判断。 借助您身边的银行、保险、信托、基金等等机构，你会发现，理财并不难。 记者董天刚 [编辑: 王好] 分享: 【 大 中 小 】【 rss订阅 】【 打印 】【 关闭 】 近日热点 市场预期年内或再加息 各大银行提前还贷潮涌现 2010 description.hltext_display: Willkie Farr & Gallagher LLP berät e.n.o. energy erneut beim Verkauf von Windparks ...
description.content:
Willkie Farr&Gallagher LLP berät e.n.o. energy erneut beim Verkauf von Windparks in Deutschland und erstmalig in Frankreich
DGAP-News: Willkie Farr&Gallagher LLP / Schlagwort(e): Verkauf/Verkauf Willkie Farr&Gallagher LLP berät e.n.o. energy erneut beim Verkauf von Windparks in Deutschland und erstmalig in Frankreich
-------------------------------------------------------------------- -
e.n.o. energy hat einen onshore Windpark bestehend aus 7 Vestas-Turbinen mit insgesamt 14 Megawatt in Rheinland-Pfalz an den niederländischen Private Equity Fonds DIF Renewable Energy verkauft.
e.n.o. energy hat überdies einen onshore Windpark in der Nähe von Le Havre, Frankreich, bestehend aus 5 Enercon-Turbinen mit insgesamt 10 Megawatt an DIF Renewable Energy verkauft, der im Juni 2011 in Betrieb gehen soll.
e.n.o. energy hat sich in den letzten zehn Jahren in der Planung, Errichtung und Finanzierung, sowie im Betriebsmanagement von Windenergieanlagen auf dem europäischen Markt etabliert.
DIF Renewable Energy ist ein in den Bereichen Wind- und Solarenergie sowie in weiteren erneuerbaren Energien spezialisierter Private Equity Fonds, dessen Fokus sowohl auf dem europäischen, wie auch auf dem nordamerikanischen Markt liegt.
Berater e.n.o. energy: Willkie Farr&Gallagher LLP (M&A/Corporate): Partners Dr. Andreas Hautkappe (lead Frankfurt), Ed Fernandez (Paris); Associates Ingo Bednarz (Frankfurt), Nicolas Tollet (Paris)
Willkie Farr&Gallagher LLP ist eine internationale Anwaltskanzlei mit mehr als 600 Anwälten mit Büros in New York, Washington, Paris, London, Mailand, Rom, Frankfurt am Main und Brüssel. Der Hauptsitz der Kanzlei ist in New York, 787 Seventh Avenue, Tel.: 001 212 728 8000.
Ende der Finanznachricht
22.12.2010 Veröffentlichung einer Corporate News/Finanznachricht, übermittelt durch die DGAP - ein Unternehmen der EquityStory AG. Für den Inhalt der Mitteilung ist der Emittent / Herausgeber verantwortlich.
Die DGAP Distributionsservices umfassen gesetzliche Meldepflichten, Corporate News/Finanznachrichten und Pressemitteilungen. Medienarchiv unter http://www.dgap-medientreff.de und http://www.dgap.de

description.hltext_display: More Oshkosh MRAPs For Special Operations
description.content:
The U.S. Army has tasked Oshkosh Defense with delivery of 40 additional MRAP All-Terrain Vehicle variants for Special Operations Forces.
The order, which includes more than 130 spare-parts kits for the mine-resistant, ambush-protected vehicles, follows earlier orders from the U.S. Army TACOM Life Cycle Management Command.
"We continue to answer the warfighters' needs in theater for the armored and highly mobile M-ATV and we have flexibility at the design, production and sustainment levels to fully support the program," said Ken Juergens, vice president and general manager of Joint Programs for Oshkosh Defense.
"The SFV variant is part of the M-ATV family of vehicles, which we designed to support the most challenging tactical operations in rugged and mountainous off-road terrain."
The M-ATV Special Forces Vehicle features alterations specific to the needs of U.S. Special Forces, including a modified cargo deck, intended to accept specialized equipment based on each mission's requirements and larger front windscreens for increased visibility.
Vehicle deliveries are to take place in May and deliveries of the spare parts are scheduled to begin in March and be completed in June.

event_or_fact.property: We continue to answer the warfighters' needs in theater for the armored and highly mobile M-ATV and we have flexibility at the design, production and sustainment levels to fully support the program; The SFV variant is part of the M-ATV family of vehicles,

description.hltext_display: Customer strategies for 21st century businesses
description.content:
The highly-connected and IT-savvy customers of the 21st century demand that organisations adopt new approaches—beyond traditional customer relationship management techniques. By Gerald Wee
Tools sponsored by
Enterprises must now work differently to retain their existing enterprise clients while also attracting new ones. Social networking and business intelligence must play an increasingly critical role in the customer relationship evolution.
These were key themes at a roundtable session held on 29 September 2010 in Singapore by CIO Asia magazine in association with Microsoft Services, the consulting and enterprise support division of software giant Microsoft.
Lim Chee Beng, solutions sales manager, CRM for services, Microsoft Services, set the stage with an introduction to customer relationship management (CRM) and how it has evolved since it originated in the mid-90s with a focus on the front office.
“We were looking at having a single view of customers with regards to salesforce automation, marketing automation, and service fulfilment and management,” he said. “People were focused on the process of managing sales and marketing services, and business intelligence tended to be more passive, restricted to analysing CRM information.”
New world order
However, the current situation is much different: the meteoric rise of social networking and cloud computing combined with the aftermath of a recent economic downturn has changed the dynamics of the business environment completely.
“We are recovering from the recession, and there is a shift from cost cutting efficiencies to working smarter and increasing the productivity of employees,” said Lim.
He cited Gartner research where the top three business priorities of CIOs are improving business processes, reducing operational costs, and increasing the use of business intelligence and analytics. “In terms of impact on the current landscape, there are a few important areas to look at with regards to CRM: cloud, social networking, and the enhanced use of BI to retain your customer,” said Lim. “It is critical to have strategies that leverage the rise of these trends.”
The following are the key highlights that followed as Ross O. Storey, managing editor of Fairfax Business Media Asia and editor of CIO Asia magazine, moderated a discussion with Lim and a panel of Singapore-based CIOs as they presented their views on managing customer relationships in a new world order.
Social networking
Lim Chee Beng: We see 500 billion minutes on Facebook every month and two million tweets per day, and this is actually growing quickly as well. We need to leverage such social media.
In the past, when you fill in forms, you only have the name and contact number, later on you need e-mail. In the future, I expect requests for Facebook or Twitter accounts where you can find the interest and hobbies of customers or prospects, information you can leverage during promotions. In addition, you may see friends or contacts to whom you may want to extend offers or discounts to relatives. That is another potential source of leads.
However, you now can’t prevent customers from going to forums or blogs to share their opinion and sentiments. These can actually make or break the reputation of companies, so businesses must be able to embrace this paradigm. Will there be a need for people to manually look at forums or links to their social networking accounts? How do you manage that? These are all aspects linked to CRM, and we are in an era where things are changing rapidly.
David Lim, general manager, IT, Centillion Environment & Recycling: I’m head of global IT at Centillion. We treat and recycle electronic waste and gold bearing hazardous solutions. As the market grows, we also move along in terms of using social networking technologies to get to the people involved.
With certain projects where we collect old PCs and servers from the public, we use Tweets and Facebook. We even show the collection points using Google maps so people transporting the PCs can access the information on their mobile phones.
Ajay Gupta, senior manager, business systems IT division, C. K. Tang: As a retailer, consumers’ interests are particularly important to us. They are becoming more informed and connected as well as demanding and value conscious. Expectations are ever rising. Everyone is talking about social networking and there is a lot of hype. It is very easy to set up, but we have no one to do real time moderation.
Ng Kok Keong, head of business infrastructure, Asia Pacific, Nokia: We ideally want the CRM to capture what the customer wants, and what has changed. For example, Facebook is big in Indonesia, and they do a lot of messaging. We need all this information to be fed back to our R&D centre so that they can create something in response to the market. That is how we make money and we are successful in emerging markets such as India and Indonesia and China.
We are serious about social networking marketing, so apart from Facebook feedback, we are working with different channels to exchange ideas with technology gurus. Nowadays, people don’t just look at marketing materials, but go to other sites to get other opinions before buying.
Business intelligence
Lim Chee Beng: We need to leverage business intelligence to provide better experiences for customers. Just customer satisfaction alone is not enough.
What is important is providing an experience that will gain loyalty. You need to get information from your system that will help you do these analyses. It could be repeated sales information or loyalty points, and how often customers are redeeming and what are the redemption patterns.
With that, you can look at the customer trends and design marketing campaigns to attract them. Product innovation also needs you to look at what the customer needs and wants, and get it to them in a timely fashion.
Gupta: In retail, there is hardly any brand loyalty. People are getting demanding, yet also value conscious. Before we even please them with customer service, how do we create a perception that they are getting good value and quality? We have to retain our customers over and over again.
What we do is to have more focused discrete marketing campaigns. We keep experimenting by looking at demographics and psychographics and past purchases, and we keep refining it with targeted messages to get more meaningful interaction. The point is to engage in such a way that it builds trust. Once customers know the information is for their benefit, they will open up.
Employee challenge
Raul Paolo Miranda, chief information officer, Asia/Australia, Rehau: In implementing CRM, we have to deal with the salespeople and manage their expectations. We have to understand that they may not be IT savvy. Our system is still in the making two years down the road.
The object is to get them to use it first, and get used to the idea of logging in their visits and opportunities. Many don’t have that discipline, even though the information is important to the company.
Now, we are looking to improve the usability, and find out what will make it more useful, and make them use the system more.
Koh Kok Tian, general manager, South Asia, IT and special projects, Borneo Motors Singapore: We try to look at it from a sales lead management system, but even starting that is a big problem. The automotive industry is very old, and people are very protective of their own customer information written down in paper notebooks. They don’t want to change, and sometimes a stick approach is needed to get them to fill in the forms. It is a change management challenge.
Lim Chee Beng: CRM is a process, not just a technology, so it always ties in with change management and adoption.
Rather than showing the stick, usually my recommendation is, apart from the ease of use, some areas to explore is putting information like their commissions and how they are performing. If that is something that can be displayed in the CRM solution, it would motivate them to go in and have a look. We are working with a customer to integrate CRM to their incentive compensation system, which will show them budgets for the year and month to month performance.
In a team environment, if I can see how my colleagues are performing, it motivates me to go into the system. Also, if there are certain periodic reports that can be easily created from the CRM system, that would motivate them to go into the system to fill out reports, since it saves them time.
Sujay Bhattacharya, director, Asia Pacific IS, IDC Asia Pacific: We have gone through different customer relationship management systems, and we notice it is not about how good the technology is, but how you can entice the salespeople who are actually talking to the customers and know the most about them, to put that information into the system.
One thing we did was to have an incentive programme every quarter where we would go through the database and find out who uses it most, and offer them a token reward. That kind of caught on, and people would vie with each other to try to be the top CRM guy. It was much easier after that.
After the initial resistance, they found that it didn’t take too much time to type in some notes so that the next time they meet that customer, it is much easier to find out what happened before.
Business analytics
Richard Tan, IT director, Institute of Systems Science: Our customer base are corporates and private individuals. Adoption of the CRM system is one problem, but what about the end results and the subsequent steps? Do we have the right people in place who can take the information created, follow up and apply it in the next campaign?
Koh: It is not easy and I see a gap in terms of what we want to do in IT, and marketing. You want to embrace a campaign in a holistic way, and not just say you want a Facebook account. How we would probably approach it is to create the database, and set it up as a kiosk concept with self service features.
I wouldn’t know what everyone wants, and it would be the marketing, analysts, and research people who know what they want. What is important is to set measurements to understand how effective the whole process is. It has also got to be quantifiable; numbers are important for us to fine tune the system as it goes along.
Instant generation
Storey: Instant messaging, according to some analysts, may even overtake e-mail as the preferred form of digital communication. The important word is ‘instant’. Customers and clients today simply have no patience.
We live in an instant gratification society where people expect enterprises to have the same agility as Facebook to receive, consider and respond to their issues.
The challenge for the corporate world is to match these consumer expectations with enterprise systems that keep clients and customers happy.
Neo Yong Chiang, chief information officer, Republic Polytechnic: We’ve looked at the trends in social networking, and we realise that students don’t really want to meet face-to-face. They’d rather send e-mail, and want an instant response and answers to questions.
So, it is not CRM technology per se, but how to respond fast enough, get the relevant information, and streamline the process to be able to respond quickly to this group of people without having dig around for the relevant information. These teenagers are the new generation of customers.
The other aspect is the advent of new gadgets such as the iPhone, iPad, or Android devices. About 30 per cent of students have them, and they will whip these out, expecting instant response times.
